content: stony point cowl the stony point cowl is a cowl version of my be simple shawl variations i wanted a cowl that was light and airy simple to knit and simple to wear i used green mountain spinnery simply fine yarn for a light but warm and sturdy cowl it is easily worn wrapped either once or twice around your neck i chose the variegated colorway which gave me the lovely sheepʼs gray pico edging this cowl could easily be adapted to to other yarn weights just make sure to choose the appropriate needle size to create the drape that you want the variations are endless finished measurements 7 1/4 by 48 after blocking lightly yarn simply fine by green mountain spinnery 40% kid mohair/60% fine wool single ply fingering weight 3 5 oz / 100g skein - approximately 450 yards / 412 m 1 skein variegated simply fine or 400 yards of fingering weight yarn needles one 32 us 6 circular needle stony point cowl gauge 18 stitches and 44 row = 4 inches gently blocked cowl cast on 200 stitches place stitch marker to mark the beginning of the round slip marker throughout to mark the beginning of each round join in the round being careful not to twist stitches note you may simplify the joining to avoid worrying about twisting stitches by knitting the first 4-6 row in garter stitch without joining knitting each row after completing the project use the extra yarn from the cast on to sew the initial garter ridges together row one knit row two purl repeat row one and two three times for a total of eight row and four garter ridges row nine knit two together yarn over repeat across row row ten purl row eleven knit row twelve purl row thirteen knit row fourteen purl row fifteen knit row sixteen purl repeat row nine through sixteen for pattern complete this eight row pattern 9 times for a total of nine eyelet row end with row sixteen picot bind-off picot bind-off *cast on 2 stitches with knitting on cast-on bind off 4 stitches slip_stitch from right hand needle back to left hand needle * repeat between *ʼs until all stitches have been bound off weave in ends soak and block according to your preference stony point cowl © 2015 carolyn glauz-todrank all rights reserved for personal noncommercial use only though this pattern is simple please honor my copyright and do not reproduce for sale
